definition: to admit responsibility and resign

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
fault/to blame/to punish/calamity/misfortune
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
office/duty

sentences.english: Online demands abound that the railway minister, Sheng Guangzu, lose his job too.
sentences.chinese: 网络热呼铁道部长盛光祖引咎辞职。

sentences.english: Because he was involved in the bribery, he acknowledged his mistake and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 因为卷入贿赂案，他愤而引咎辞职。

sentences.english: President Fernando de la Rúa resigned.
sentences.chinese: 政府总统费尔南多德拉鲁引咎辞职。

sentences.english: Sheng Minamata also revealed that Tokyo Electric Power president also intends to resign water.
sentences.chinese: 胜俣同时透露，东电社长清水也有意引咎辞职。

sentences.english: The resigned county head of environmental protection was identified as Chen Jun'an.
sentences.chinese: 县环保局长陈军安引咎辞职。

definition: to take the blame/to accept responsibility (for a mistake)
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to ask sb to resign from a post
to resign
to suspend (sb) from duties
to demote (to a lower rank)

to go off the stage/to fall from position of prestige/to step down (from office etc)/to disentangle oneself/to get off the hook
to leave office
to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to dismiss an employee/to sack
